intro: Hemigymnia multinodis, commonly known as the nodular hemigymnia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems with distinctive nodular structures. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Hemigymnia multinodis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests.
